title: How to Make Banana Pudding Squares

steps.headline: Crush vanilla wafers in a food storage bag using a rolling pin.
steps.description: You can also crush the wafers using a frying pan or food processor.

steps.headline: Mix crushed wafers and butter in a bowl.
Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.
Mix cream cheese and powdered sugar until well blended, then stir in 1 1/2 cups of Cool Whip.
Spread cream cheese  mixture evenly over the crushed wafer crust and set aside.
Cut bananas in half crosswise, then cut each piece lengthwise in half.
Lay sliced bananas over the cream cheese mixture.
Pour milk into large bowl, and add dry pudding mixes.
steps.description: Beat with wire whisk 2 minutes, then spoon over bananas. Spread remaining Cool Whip over the top.

steps.headline: Sprinkle pudding mixture with grated chocolate.
Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

text: Crush vanilla wafers in a food storage bag using a rolling pin. You can also crush the wafers using a frying pan or food processor. Mix crushed wafers and butter in a bowl.  Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.  Mix cream cheese and powdered sugar until well blended, then stir in 1 1/2 cups of Cool Whip.  Spread cream cheese  mixture evenly over the crushed wafer crust and set aside.  Cut bananas in half crosswise, then cut each piece lengthwise in half.  Lay sliced bananas over the cream cheese mixture.  Pour milk into large bowl, and add dry pudding mixes. Beat with wire whisk 2 minutes, then spoon over bananas. Spread remaining Cool Whip over the top. Sprinkle pudding mixture with grated chocolate.  Chill at least 3 hours before serving.  Finished.
